title: FIA: Fluorescence Image Aligner - Robust Motion Correction with Dense Flow for ImageJ/Fiji (v3.1.0)
description:
FIA (Fluorescence Image Aligner) v3.1.0 is a major update introducing the Dense Flow Engine, a state-of-the-art non-rigid registration method designed specifically for low-SNR biological time-lapse microscopy.

v3.1.0 Highlights: The "Dense Flow" Update
This release addresses the critical challenge of aligning noisy fluorescence data (e.g., Calcium/Voltage imaging) by introducing Temporal Averaging and Contrast Enhancement (CLAHE) into the motion estimation pipeline.

Key Features:

  • ðŸš€ New "Dense Flow" Engine (Non-Rigid):
    • Super Reference: Eliminates the "floating anchor" problem by averaging N frames (user-definable Ref Depth) to create a noise-free reference target.
    • Feature Enhancement: Internally applies CLAHE (Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization) to reveal tissue structure in dark/low-contrast regions before calculating flow.
    • Robustness: Significantly outperforms standard Optical Flow on noisy, in-vivo brain imaging datasets.
  • ðŸ”¬ Scientific Integrity:
    • Navigation vs. Transport: Motion vectors are calculated using the enhanced (blurred/CLAHE) images, but the transformation is applied to the original raw data using high-precision cubic interpolation.
    • Quantitative Safe: Ensures that pixel intensity values (DN) are preserved for accurate ΔF/F analysis.
  • âš“ Dual-Engine Core:
    • OpenCV ECC: Remains the gold standard for sub-pixel Rigid/Affine alignment (Rotation + Translation).
    • Legacy Stabilizer: A fallback kernel based on Kang Li's Lucas-Kanade algorithm for systems without OpenCV or for large-displacement stabilization.
  • ðŸ§  Smart UI: Parameter panels now dynamically adapt to the selected mode, revealing advanced settings (Flow WinSize, PolyN) only when needed.
